stream_context.summary: Kaze focuses on Course 12’s Wild-West saloon, importing and programming a piano-playing Shy Guy, debugging a sudden RAM overflow crash, and sketching the upcoming ‘high-noon’ duel sequence with Boshi using Mario Party 2’s card gun model.

development_findings.summary: Zeina’s piano-playing Shy Guy and piano were imported; Kaze added vertex-color lighting tweaks, dialog, looping animation, and panned audio so music feels spatial.
development_findings.quote: The piano needs to be solid... I’m going to pan the music so that it sounds like the guy is playing it.

development_findings.summary: When Mario talks to the Shy Guy, music stops and all NPCs turn to face Mario for comedic effect; implemented via Western NPC behavior update.
development_findings.quote: When the piano guy stops the music, the entire bar should look at you.

development_findings.summary: Initial import triggered mysterious crashes traced to RAM overflow; merging collision meshes and removing duplicate geo layouts freed memory.
development_findings.quote: It’s a RAM overflow – we’re out of memory… if I just make a mesh out of it that removed 800 triangles, it should be fine now.

development_findings.summary: Discovered optimisation opportunity: correct use of object-interaction lists to skip unnecessary checks, plus inlining a sound-thread function saved ~0.2 µs per frame.
development_findings.quote: We just gained around 0.2 microseconds of performance in Act Idle. Isn’t that amazing?

development_findings.summary: Explained low-level write optimisation: invalidating cache lines before 16-byte stores halves memory bandwidth in render thread.
development_findings.quote: When you write 4 bytes, you actually read 16… Use CACHE INVALIDATE so you never read from RAM first.

development_findings.summary: Fast3DX2 is currently used; Fast3DX3 planned but suffers a 20 % FPS drop due to a discovered bug.
development_findings.quote: Fast3DX3… has a pretty significant mark we found where it slows the game down 20 %.

development_findings.summary: High-noon duel concept: 3-2-1 countdown model, ominous music, Mario pulls the card gun; requires modelling countdown and ripping Mario Party 2 gun via QED.
development_findings.quote: We’re going to have the camera be here, the countdown goes 3-2-1-go, Mario pulls out his card gun and whoever shoots first wins.

development_findings.summary: Created Yoshi Coin #4 earned by ‘listening to the piano’; placeholder in code.
development_findings.quote: Yoshi coins – listening to the piano – it’s coin 4.

development_findings.summary: VS Code auto-format broke mid-stream, causing manual indentation; flagged as tech-debt issue.
development_findings.quote: Dude, the not having the auto-indenting work is so annoying.

context_findings.summary: Kaze only recently learned the importance of ‘soft skills’ and says it changes his outlook on collaborating.
context_findings.quote: Someone explained to me what soft skills are… That changes everything.

context_findings.summary: ROM hacks are officially a ‘hobby’, but he still works on them full-time alongside an NDA-bound Unreal Engine 5 day job.
context_findings.quote: ROM hacks are technically just a hobby but I do work on them full-time.

context_findings.summary: Shows excitement when the Shy Guy loop works smoothly and frustration when VS Code formatting or crashes occur.
Protective about leaks; will not send builds to strangers despite requests.
context_findings.quote: Anyone can say ‘I won’t leak it’. I have no idea who you are.

zeina.summary: Provided the model and animations for the piano-playing Shy Guy and piano, praised for good vertex colouring.
zeina.quote: Zeina has animated and modeled [him] and she’s given him a piano too.

zeina.summary: Watched later in stream; Kaze demonstrated finished implementation to get her feedback.
zeina.quote: Zeina, you missed the Shy Guy… Look what I made out of your Shy Guy.

key_stories.title: Piano Shy Guy Import
key_stories.summary: Adding Zeina’s piano-playing Shy Guy caused crashes and lighting mismatches. Kaze corrected vertex colours, implemented directional audio, wrote dialog triggers, and solved an out-of-memory crash by merging collision meshes.
key_stories.challenge: Level crashed on load after new asset; lighting also felt off.
key_stories.process: Tweaked lighting in Blender; identified duplicate geo layouts; used debugger, found RAM overflow; merged 800+ collision triangles; rewrote animation/pointer logic.
key_stories.outcome: Level loads; music plays from right speaker; dialog stops music; crowd reacts.
key_stories.key_quote: It’s a RAM overflow – we’re out of memory… merging that mesh removed 800 triangles.

key_stories.title: Micro-optimisation Hunt
key_stories.summary: Kaze continually shaved microseconds: inline sound-thread function, better object lists, cache-invalidate trick; shares philosophy of squeezing 60 FPS on real hardware.
key_stories.challenge: Maintain 60 FPS as Course 12 nears memory/CPU limits.
key_stories.process: Audited Act Idle path, inlined function, reassigned objects to correct lists, explained cache-line invalidation.
key_stories.outcome: Saved ~0.2 µs per frame; confidence level still hits 60 FPS on console.
key_stories.key_quote: You just live watched me gain 0.2 microseconds of performance.

key_stories.title: High-Noon Duel Planning
key_stories.summary: Designing finale of Wild-West level: cinematic letterbox view, 3-2-1 countdown, Mario vs Boshi with Mario Party 2 card gun.
key_stories.challenge: Need new assets (gun, countdown) and camera choreography without blowing memory.
key_stories.process: Framed camera, experimented with letterbox bars, planned to rip gun model via QED and 3D-model countdown.
key_stories.outcome: Concept locked; implementation postponed until assets sourced.
key_stories.key_quote: We’re going to model a countdown and then Mario will pull out his card gun; whoever shoots first wins.
